info.headline: Flood Warning issued August 18 at 8:05PM CDT until August 21 at 11:36AM CDT by NWS La Crosse WI
info.description:
...The National Weather Service in La Crosse WI has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Minnesota...
Dobbins Creek at Austin 2NE affecting Mower County.
...Forecast flooding changed from Minor to Moderate severity and increased in duration for the following rivers in Iowa...
Cedar River at Charles City affecting Floyd County.
* WHAT...Moderate flooding is forecast.
* WHERE...Cedar River at Charles City.
* WHEN...From Tuesday morning to late Thursday morning.
* IMPACTS...At 15.0 feet, Leland Avenue and Park Drive at 19th Avenue begins to flood.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:45 PM CDT Monday the stage was 7.7 feet. - Bankfull stage is 9.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage tomorrow morning to a crest of 15.4 feet early Wednesday morning. It will then fall below flood stage late Wednesday evening. - Flood stage is 12.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 15.4 feet on 03/24/2011. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
Additional river and weather information is available at www.weather.gov/lacrosse.
The next statement will be issued Tuesday morning by 815 AM CDT.

parameter.value: FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM TUESDAY MORNING TO LATE THURSDAY MORNING
